original: Alvin, Erik Gustaf Marcus, musikdirektör, Vänersborg, f. 6/5/02 i Norrköp. av Karl A. o. Hilda Öhrström. G. 39 m. Inga Sahlin. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 20, org:ex. 23, musiklär:- o. kyrkosångarex. 28 v. mu.sikhö’gsk. Stud:resa t. Frankr. 26. — Musiklär. v. Vänersk h. a. 1. sed. 32. Org. o. kantor v. Vänersb. kyrka ’sed. s. å. Timlär. v. komm. flicksk. sed. 32. Di-rig. v. Vänersb. orkifören. sed. 44, v. sångsällsk. Sjung, sjung sed. 33, förste förb :dirig. v. Dalsl. sång:förb. sed. 33. Komp. kantat., manskvart., romanser m. m. Hobbies: tennis, segl. P. A. Bergs jeton i orgelspel 23, Mus. ak. jeton i komp. 24, Dalsl. sångiförb. ftjGM 33, Sv. sångiförb. ftjGM 38.
translated: Alvin, Erik Gustaf Marcus, musical director, Vänersborg, born May 6th, 1902 in Norrköping to Karl A. and Hilda Öhrström. Married in 1939 to Inga Sahlin. He graduated from high school in Norrköping in 1920, obtained his organist degree in 1923, his music teacher and church singer degree in 1928 from the music college. He traveled to France in 1926 for study purposes. He has been a music teacher at Vänersborg high school since 1932 and an organist and cantor at Vänersborg church since the same year. He has been a hourly teacher at the municipal girls' school since 1932. He directed the Vänersborg orchestra association from 1944 and the singing society "Sjung, sjung" since 1933, as well as the first association conductor of Dalsland's singing association since 1933. He composed cantatas, male quartets, romances, etc. His hobbies are tennis and sailing. He received the P.A. Berg's token in organ playing in 1923, the Music Academy token in composition in 1924, the Dalsland's singing association silver medal in 1933, and the Swedish singing association silver medal in 1938.

education.name: Musiklär:- o. kyrkosångarex. (Music Teacher and Church Singer Degree)
Stud:resa t. Frankr. (Study trip to France)

awards.name: P.A. Berg's Token in Organ Playing
